What could be the problem? I have uBlock Origin ad blocker installed.

title: LinkedIn crashes
content:
Hello friends,

So, I've recently started using firefox. I use linkedin almost like the entire day and it never seems to work right in firefox. Same options, filters, searches seems to work well in chrome and ARC. But simple actions like searching people or companies in Firefox is taking like 2 3 mins(if it's in a good mood) or it just never loads. The site crashes.

I could say that, it happens for almost any of the function in LinkedIn. But some other job portals works fine. Also, I've tried opening in privacy mode (where it works well) and I have also removed the extensions like ublock and privacy badger. Still, no positive signs.

So what's the issue here? Can anyone help me with this? I reported the page for being slow in loading. But i believe that's not going to be of huge help.

title: Firefox search engine keeps using wrong default search
content: I always use google as my default search engine for firefox. I recently got a message saying firefox had been updated. Ever since, whenever I search for something it keeps using yahoo as the default search engine instead of google. I checked the settings and google IS selected as the default search engine. The weird thing is, if I set the default search engine to something like ebay or wikipedia it will use that correctly. It's just that when google is selected it goes to yahoo instead. I appreciate any help, thank you.

title: Unable to log in to AT&T using Mozilla browser
content:
duplicate of /questions/1489982 thread

I have the latest Mozilla Firefox download after uninstalling the prior version and re-downloading the latest on my windows 10 PC 3 times. I did this after my sign in to AT&T web mail failed to allow me to sign in. I had cleared cookies and cache. I get a window from AT&T saying "somethings gone wrong and try resetting your WiFi" when signing in. I am able to use the Mozilla browser to get to other websites including Yahoo or AT&T. I talked to AT&T and they had me sign into my webmail using MS edge. No problem, and also using MS explorer browser. They said Mozilla browzer was the problem. Anyhelp on solving this will be appreciated.
creator: Bob9754
